articles.title: Asa Miller records DNF in Winter Olympics giant slalom - Rappler
articles.description: Waiting for almost two hours for his turn, Filipino-American skier Asa Miller fails to complete his run in the men's giant slalom no thanks to an early slip
articles.content: MANILA, Philippines Filipino-American skier Asa Miller crashed to a rough start in his Beijing Winter Olympics campaign after registering a DNF (did not finish) in the men’s giant slalom on Sunday, F… [+1806 chars]

articles.title: Kaillie Humphries grabs big monobob lead in search of 1st Olympic medal as American - CBC Sports
articles.description: Competing for the first time in the Olympics as an American citizen, Calgary-born Kaillie Humphries has grabbed control of the inaugural monobob competition at the Beijing Olympics.
articles.content:
Usually at the midway point of an Olympic women's bobsleigh race, the standings are super close.
Not this one.
Kaillie Humphries' first day of Olympic competition for the United States was a runawa… [+5002 chars]

articles.title: Canada's Brad Gushue snaps 2-game skid with crucial win over U.S. in men's Olympic curling - CBC Sports
articles.description: Brad Gushue and Canada bounced back in a major way with a 10-5 win over defending Olympic gold medallist John Shuster and his American team in the men’s curling round robin at the Beijing Games on Sunday morning.

articles.title: Commentary: Cut carbs when you're on a sugar detox but keep fruit on your diet - CNA
articles.description: Fruits offer much more than just sugar. Increasing fruit intake while decreasing artificial sugar consumption will significantly reduce blood sugar, says an American expert.
articles.content:
Humans evolved to crave sweet tastes to get the nutrients needed to survive. A daily supply of vitamins, minerals and fibre is needed because our bodies cannot make them.
The best source of these su… [+1060 chars]
